column4: anyone think of any good ways to backup mass amounts of data ?
How much?
lots :D 500 gigs ?
i need to get 50 gigs backed up as well and its to much data for a 40/80 tape i was thinking rsync ?
Oh boy.
Dual-layered DVDs?  (If you have a burner.)
thats wat 8 or 9 gigs
Each, yeah.  You'd need a lot still.
dvds are not really accepted as a way of backing up
How big do external hard drives come?
as big as internal
Which is?
but a hard drive is not a very good way of backing up either :D
300 gigs or more
thinking about just rsync'ing a couple of boxes off site and onsitte
All right then, print off everything that's a document, and see how much is left.  That out to be a fool-proof backup.
wat ?
Honestly, if none of those options are going to work for your purposes, I really don't know.
there all cad drawings
Ah.
So if those aren't considered good ways of backing up, you must have gotten that opinion from somewhere, so what does your source suggest?
